data.Location: Cosenza (Confluence of Crati and Busento rivers)
data.Recommended Reason: Historical accounts consistently identify this area as the burial site of Alaric with Roman treasure
data.Supporting Evidence: Italian scientists have identified five potential sites where the tomb may be located; Contemporary 5th century historical accounts describe river diversion for burial161718

data.Recommended Reason: Multiple archaeological layers spanning Greek and Roman periods underneath the modern city
data.Supporting Evidence: Excavations at Monastero Santa Chiara revealed a complete Roman bathhouse from 1st century CE; San Lorenzo Maggiore site contains Roman market and Greek agora from 5th-4th century BCE14

data.Recommended Reason: One of the world's oldest continuously inhabited settlements with unique cave dwellings and churches
data.Supporting Evidence: UNESCO World Heritage site with approximately 150 rock churches containing Byzantine frescoes and artifacts dating back to Paleolithic times15
